title: Nashwauk 2012 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a full-bodied, creamy-textured wine, bursting with irrepressible fruit. Blueberries take the lead, backed by plums and a lesser amount of raspberry, all accented by hints of cracked pepper, baking spices and vanilla. While delicious already, the wine shows enough richness and length on the finish to warrant keeping through 2025.

title: Fable Mountain 2012 Syrah (Tulbagh)
description: There's a spicy soul to this beautiful Syrah, as forward notes of white pepper, licorice and sweet spice abound on the nose and mouth, infusing the raspberry, cherry and brambly blackberry fruits throughout. Additional notes of purple violets, fynbos and black tea add depth and interest. Medium weight, the approachable palate boasts a crushed satin texture, with fine yet gripping tannins that hang on through the spicy finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Foxen 2014 Ernesto Wickenden Vineyard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)
description: One of the more anticipated alternative whites from Santa Barbara County each year, this wine shows light honey brittle, sour tangerine and a touch of sour cream on a bright and lithe nose. The palate offers delicate cherimoya and soft nectarine fruit cut by lime juice and orange rinds, proving light but bursting with energy and flavors.

title: Primosic 2010 Klin White (Collio)
description: Aromas of toast, candied nectarine zest and vanilla open on this blend of Pinot Bianco, Friulano, Sauvignon and Ribolla Gialla. The savory palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, apricot and butterscotch alongside bright acidity.

title: Lobo 2010 Selecção Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Península de Setúbal)
description: This is a rich and structured wine. It has ripe tannins that are shot through with dark plum fruits. Now with some age, it is broad, complex and dense. The freshness of the acidity is still there, filling the glass with aromatic perfumes from the Touriga Nacional in the blend. Drink now.

title: McCay Cellars 2013 Lodi Native TruLux Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)
description: Effusive aromas like raspberry and strawberry jam lead to more exotic chocolate and orange-zest flavors and a lush, ripe texture. The body is quite full but the generous and expressive flavors balance it well. This is a big, extravagant and delicious wine.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Florimont Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Very ripe pear notes mingle with marzipan on the nose and lead to a very fruity, juicy palate of rich pear flavors. There is a little sweetness but the purity of ripe pear beautifully pervades everything and maintains freshness. Finishes off-dry with ringing fruit.

title: Lagarde 2012 Primeras Viñas Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)
description: The aromatic greeting on this old-vines Cab is smooth, harmonious and elegant, with notes of plum, cassis, tobacco and fine oak. The palate is a bit high-pitched, with racy acidity, while flavors of herbs, tomato, spiced berry fruits and oak finish similar, with dry, drawing tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: On Q 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine sees slightly less new oak than its companion, Appassionata, giving way to classic elements of cedar, pencil lead and clove. Firm, soft tannins round out the palate, exhibiting the small percentages of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc blended in. The wine finishes in smoke and chocolate. Drink now through 2020.

title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2014 Branco Cerceal (Beira Atlantico)
description: This wood aged wine is ripe with perfumed fruits and an open, generous structure. It is full of ripe apricot and red apple flavors tightened with a mineral texture and acidity. The toast from the wood aging is a gentle theme in the background. Drink from late 2016.

title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Reserva Branco White (Douro)
description: With its fine, fresh, crisp fruits this is already a deliciously fresh wine. It has touches of oak that give the wine a spicy, creamy character. The wine is rich, full in the mouth while remaining fresh and tangy. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2017.

title: Penner-Ash 2013 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: A lovely wine, this holds streaks of tart raspberries, fresh herbs and light chocolate. Elegant and nicely detailed, it's based as much upon crystal-clear acids as firm, ripe tannins.

title: St Hallett 2014 Riesling (Eden Valley)
description: This is appropriately austere for a young Eden Valley Riesling, offering crisp green apple and lime sensations backed by subtle grace notes of wet stone. The finish is long, mouthwatering and almost painfully tart, suggesting it will fare well in the cellar for up to 10 years.

title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2013 Hannah Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This block selection is supple, almost silky, and coats the palate with lip-licking cherry-fruit goodness. Streaks of hazelnut and nougat extend the finish. This delicious wine spent 15 months in 50% new French oak.

title: William Hatcher 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Young and stiff upon being opened, this is striated with flavors and scents of earthy beet, rhubard, raspberry and strawberry. The palate brings in accents of iron filings, mushroom and further complexity. It's a sturdy, medium-weight, earthy wine, with moderate aging potention. Drink now through 2023.

title: Waterstone 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a floral, zesty and vibrant white wine, given six months in French oak, half of it new. With a complex hit of briny salt and citrus, it flirts between layers of savory and sweet, finding just the right balance of structure and acidity.

title: Sanford 2012 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine from one of the state's most historic vineyards shows chai spice, blueberry, olallieberry juice and a touch of juniper on the nose. The palate is a bit less complex, offering herbal notes of oregano and licorice that pop out of joyous notes of plum.

title: Scott Paul 2013 La Paulée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Sophisticated and subtle, this lovely wine expresses varietal elegance, with a bouquet of roses and raspberries to begin. The jumble of pretty fruits is framed with citrus peel and a dusting of chocolate.

title: Willm 2013 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: A closed nose shows the faintest notes of quince. The palate is dry and fresh with lots of lemony zestiness. It's slender and clean with a wonderful, straightlaced backbone. Freshness and tautness signal a purposeful, lively wine, full of apple fruit and aromatic overtones of quince.

title: Wirra Wirra 2013 Church Block Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: At 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a firm, cassis-scented wine, but one that includes hints of ripeness and generous fruit. Dried herbs and brown sugar add nuance, while the velvety finish picks up some meaty, savory notes. Drink now–2025.

title: Burrell School Vineyards 2011 Principal's Choice Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From a winery atop Summit Road between Santa Cruz and San Jose comes this wine with a hefty, rich nose of fresh-pressed raspberry, black plum and strawberry notes, boosted by Dr Pepper and light licorice spice. Notes of nutmeg and allspice mix with juniper, dried plum and boysenberry on the lush palate.

title: C. von Nell-Breuning 2014 Kaseler Dominikanerberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Breathtaking lime acidity pierces through this ebulliently fruity kabinett. The palate is a crush of sweet, fresh yellow peach and apricot flavors, lined by a steely edge of minerality. It's fleeting and frail in mouthfeel yet packs a firm punch through a lingering finish. Drink now through 2020 to enjoy its youthful vitality.

title: Château Lafleur-Gazin 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Firm with spicy, generous tannins, this is a wine that is showing both ripe black fruits and wood aging flavors. The wood will temper as the ripe, full black fruits develop. It has good aging potential.

title: Château les Ormes Sorbet 2015 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This shows a fine combination of zesty black currant tones and soft tannins, giving a wine more fruity in character. The tannins offer just enough structure to develop.

title: Château Plince 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. There is a fine mix of firm tannins and generous fruit in this wine. It has blackberry fruits that are supported up by a black plum skin texture. This is a solid wine that finishes with a crisper aftertaste.

title: Clos Badon-Thunevin 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Well-structured, there is a fine spicy character, a dense texture and juicy black-plum flavors in this wine. It will develop well over the medium term.

title: Dante Robere 2013 Estate Reserve Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has gorgeous, obvious cedar and toasted-bread aromas. Oozing with fruit and oak richness, it tastes like blueberry syrup and cocoa. Very full bodied, it wallops the taste buds, weaves around the mouth and lingers on the finish.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2012 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This vineyard is often featured in designate bottlings from some of Oregon's best producers. Here the black fruits impress immediately, with dense and powerful black cherry and cassis flavors. At first tight and slightly chalky, this wine responds very well to aggressive aeration, and the AVA's typical minerality emerges.

title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2011 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Very gentle, perfumed honeysuckle notes are distinct and enticing on the nose. The palate follows this with a perfumed, opulent medium-sweetness that is reminiscent of sugar-plums and candied fruit pastilles: there are peach and plum and unbridled richness with a slight phenolic grip.
